trial_identification.studytitle: The effects of acupunture in women with endometriosis
trial_identification.scientifictitle: pain and quality of life in women diagnosed with endometriosis and treated with acupunture

interventions.interventions: Acupunture will be applied in 27 diferent points of the body for 6 weeks, twice a week. The acupunture needles will be kept in place for 20 minutes for each session. Considering that first the needles will be applied on the frontal region of the body, then on the posterior region of the body. Each session will take approximately one hour.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline and after 6 weeks of treatment

primaryOutcome.outcome: Quality of life measured with the Brazilian version of the Endometriosis Health Profile Questionnaire - EHP-30
primaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline and after 6 weeks of treatment

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: At least 18 years of age and to have a diagnosis of endometriosis for at least one year
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: To have been submitted to surgery of the pelvic area in the past 6 months

trial_design.concealment: Randomization will be performed by a researcher not involved in defining whether the participant is eligible for the study. Also, we will use sealed opaque envelopes to ensure concealment allocation.
trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation by using a randomization table created by a computer software (i.e., computerised sequence generation)

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Universidade do Estado de Santa Catarina

othercollaborator.othercollaboratoraddress: Rua Pascoal Simone, 358 - Coqueiros, Florianopolis - SC, CEP 88080-350

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of the study is to evaluate whether acupunture can decrease the pain and improve the quality of life of women with endometriosis. It is possible that acupunture will significantly decrease the pain and improve the quality of life of those women

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Comite de Etica em Pesquisa em Seres Humanos da UDESC (Research Ethics Committee in Humans - UDESC)
